paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR V30M mutation in the context of Familial Amyloidotic Polyneuropathy, detailing its effects, penetrance, and the role of glial cells in TTR uptake and degradation.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: FAP samples analyzed in this study presented TTR amyloid deposition.

functional_data.summary: The study indicates that TTR is internalized by Schwann cells and satellite cells, suggesting a role in TTR clearance.

variants.segregation_data: The V30M mutation segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The study emphasizes the importance of TTR in the pathogenesis of FAP and its accumulation in glial cells.
key_quotes: Transthyretin V30M mutation is the most common variant leading to Familial Amyloidotic Polyneuropathy.
FAP samples analyzed in this study presented TTR amyloid deposition.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR V30M variant.
